results.title: The effect of blood pressure lowering medications on the prevention of episodic migraine: A systematic review and meta-analysis.
results.text_hl: Data were collected on four outcomes - monthly @<m>DISEASE_Headache</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006261 @@@headache@@@ or @DISEASE_Migraine_Disorders @DISEASE_MESH:D008881 @@@migraine@@@ days, and monthly @<m>DISEASE_Headache</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006261 @@@headache@@@ or @DISEASE_Migraine_Disorders @DISEASE_MESH:D008881 @@@migraine attacks@@@, with a standardised mean difference calculated for overall.

citations.NLM: Carcel C, Haghdoost F, Shen J, Nanda P, Bai Y, Atkins E, Torii-Yoshimura T, Clough AJ, Davies L, Cordato D, Griffiths LR, Balicki G, Wang X, Vidyasagar K, Malavera A, Anderson CS, Zagami AS, Delcourt C, Rodgers A. The effect of blood pressure lowering medications on the prevention of episodic migraine: A systematic review and meta-analysis. Cephalalgia. 2023 Jun;43(6):3331024231183166. PMID: 37350141

results.title: Comparison of the antihypertensive effects of betaxolol to atenolol.
results.text_hl: The most common side effects noted were @DISEASE_Bradycardia @DISEASE_MESH:D001919 @@@bradycardia@@@, @DISEASE_Fatigue @DISEASE_MESH:D005221 @@@fatigue@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Headache</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006261 @@@headache@@@. The incidence of these and of central nervous system side effects was similar between the @CHEMICAL_Betaxolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D015784 @@@betaxolol@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ groups.

citations.NLM: Mroczek WJ, Burris JF, Hogan LB, Citron DC, Barker AH, McDonald RH. Comparison of the antihypertensive effects of betaxolol to atenolol. Am J Cardiol. 1988 Apr 1;61(10):807-11. PMID: 2895577

results.title: [Felodipine in arterial hypertension. Double-blind comparison with atenolol].
results.text_hl: Supine blood pressure decreased from 177 +/- 22/107 +/- 8 mmHg to 152 +/- 27/91 +/- 13 mmHg with @CHEMICAL_Felodipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D015736 @@@felodipine@@@ and from 176 +/- 19/107 +/- 8 to 152 +/- 24/91 +/- 12 with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@. Side effects recorded by means of active questioning were @DISEASE_Ankle_Injuries @DISEASE_MESH:D016512 @@@ankle oedemas@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Headache</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006261 @@@headache@@@ with @CHEMICAL_Felodipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D015736 @@@felodipine@@@ and @DISEASE_Fatigue @DISEASE_MESH:D005221 @@@fatigue@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Headache</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006261 @@@headache@@@ with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@.

citations.NLM: Andrejak M, Witchitz S, Morand P, Lesbre JP, Raveau-Landon C. [Felodipine in arterial hypertension. Double-blind comparison with atenolol]. Therapie. 1989 May-Jun;44(3):167-70. PMID: 2675377

results.title: A comparative study of atenolol, nifedipine and their combination in the treatment of hypertension.
results.text_hl: A similar pattern was observed for 24-hour ambulatory blood pressure measurements. @<m>DISEASE_Headache</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006261 @@@Headache@@@ was the most significant adverse effect.
